input_text:
Job Title: Crash Reconstruction Specialist-Trauma

Location: Falls Church, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Health Care Provider, Other

Description:
Requirements for consideration:Minimum Education:High School diploma or GED equivalent; National Automotive Sampling System training completed within six months of hire date.Years of Experience:5 years experience in crash reconstruction.Job ResponsibilitiesDevelops monthly and quarterly reports and presentations for the CIREN Program. Establishes and maintains a variety of relationships with outside agencies and consultants, in support of the project. Manages the Crash Investigation Sampling System (CISS) database in support of the CIREN Project. Perform Crash Investigation Sampling System quality crash reconstruction.Performs CISS quality crash reconstruction. Performs scene inspection requiring retrieval of physical evidence, location determination, ascertainment of vehicle(s) speed and travel direction, and measurement of road evidence (tire, scuff marks, etc.). Performs exterior examination of vehicles involving detailed measurement of damage and crush profiles. Performs interior vehicle inspection including examination of glazing, restraint systems, steering column, seats, and other vehicle compartment structures for precise documentation of damage extent, intrusion, and occupant contact points.Collects and records data consisting of written documentation and photographic evidence in accordance with CISS CDC Digital Photographic Guidelines.Enters appropriate and accurate data into the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration’s (NHTSA) CDAN single sign-on CIREN application. Assesses data on an ongoing basis for submission to QC Control.Prepares crash summary to include measurements, vehicle dynamics, occupant kinematics, and crash analysis. Prepares and submits a scaled scene diagram using the FARO Zone 2D program. Presents findings at scheduled case review conferences involving multi-disciplinary discussions concerning injury-producing mechanisms as required.Interfaces various Police Departments in the Virginia, Maryland and West Virginia area for support in data collection and crash reconstruction efforts.Other duties as assigned.
Inova Employee Benefits and Perks:Health, Vision, and Dental CoverageLife Insurance, Short/Long Term DisabilityNEW! 4 weeks PAID PARENTAL LEAVERetirement: Inova matches dollar for dollar the first 5% of your eligible pay that you contribute to the planCompetitive salary: Pay based experienceAmazing Paid Time Off: Accrue PTO hours on your very first day of workSupplemental Plans: Including Auto/Home Insurance discounts, Pet Insurance, Identity Theft ProtectionAdditional Benefits: Educational Assistance of up to $5,250/year, Student Loan Refinancing, Adoption Assistance, Child Care Centers, Scholarship Program, Free Parking, Exclusive savings opportunities to in-store events, theme parks, discounts, movie tickets and local offerings and so much more!
See Full List of Benefits and Eligibility Here: 2023 INOVA BENEFITS GUIDE

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
